description:
First time I had Philz was four Saturdays ago here. 

We (my cousins, my aunt, & my cupcake) made a quick pit stop before heading to this new mini golf place. 

I got the mint mojito and it pretty good: no complaints.
author: Lilian L.

description:
Today's order:
* Dancing Water 
       * Straight up (no cream, no sugar)

Pros:
* The drink was as good as to be expected from  
   any Philz  
* The baristas were quick

Cons:
* The location (which is also their corporate office)  
   didn't give off the most inviting feeling
* It may be because their bosses are right upstairs 
   but the baristas didn't seem as cheery and jovial 
   as I've experienced from many of their other   
   locations
* Due to the vibe from the workers it didn't feel like  
   this was somewhere I would want to plant myself   
   and get work done
author: Dillon T.

description:
I was introduced to Philz this past week when I was visiting the Bay Area for work. I have travelled extensively both domestically and internationally, and I can confidently endorse Philz as one of the best coffees I have had . . . ever. Their extensive list of 20+ choices is more like a wine list than a coffee shop touting their one or two daily roasts. And with each cup individually ground and brewed when you order you always know you're getting a fresh cup. Staff are friendly, and I loved that they're not a bunch of coffee snobs. They simply brew world-class coffee. Enough said. 

If you've not yet tried Philz, you're missing a wonderful cup of joe. Enjoy!
author: Mike C.

description: Really friendly employees and spacious / fun place to hang out while you finish your drink.
author: MiNa C.

description:
Yep - this is another Philz I'm reviewing and all my standard comments apply here: excellent service; great coffee flavors (I got the iced mocha this time and was absolutely deliccciousss) and there's some interesting food options here + the good pricing. 

For this venue in particular, though, I wanted to just point out that it's pretty huge. Two stories with ample seating all over; outlets; a not too bad WiFi connection. Just all-around a stellar cafe stop that's great for studying, reading or just meeting up.
author: John W.

description:
I didn't even know this location existed!  It's super clean, large, perfect for doing some work...and cmon, it's Philz.  I'm a huge advocate of this local company.  The coffee is always spot on.  They also offer made to order food items to go with your cup of joe.  

If you can, bring in your own tumbler.  They charge you for a small and fill it to the brim.  Well worth it.  Don't forget to order with your custom amount of sweet and cream.  I'm a light and light kinda gal but don't let that stop you from getting it philz way (reg and reg).  

Jacob's Wonderbar and Tesora are 2 of my faves but I will switch it up every so often.  Mint mojito is an every now and then treat!

5 solid stars.
author: Jen W.

description:
Omg this is my favorite Philz that I've been to. It's located in the Dogpatch area. It's a semi quiet neighbourhood, parking is pretty easy. Some bike parking also. There's plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. It's brightly lit and filled with large communal style tables. It's the perfect spot to get work done! It's a very modern and contemporary design inside. LOVE IT. 

Coffee is typical of Philz -- delicious. Obviously. It's also cool that this is the Philz HQ because they test out new recipes and stuff here. My go to is still the Philtered Soul. Sometimes I go for the Aromatic Arabic (I think that's what it was called). The avocado toast here is also quite delicious. But pricy. That's avo toast in SF for ya!
author: Amy T.

description:
The consistency doesn't drop here, like all the other Philz in the area this place doesn't let you down for the perfect cup of coffee. All menu options are the same as the other locations and the coffee is always handmade by the delicious cup. 
This location has ample seating, tables, and outlets to dare I say it even get a little work done if it's not too busy. The staff here are friendly and welcoming and if you're in the neighborhood with a itch for coffee/tea this place will get you right
author: Peter P.

description:
If you're an avid Philz fanatic, there are a few locations you NEED to visit--the first one being the OG first ever Philz in the Mission on 24th St and another one being THIS ONE!! The Philz HQ!!

It's tucked away in a kinda quiet industrial neighborhood, so you won't get any of the usual crazy hustle and bustle of SF. There's some outdoor seating, as well as tons of space inside!! The inside is SUPER HIP!! So nicely decorated, and it has a nice modern vibe!!

My go-to drink orders:
- 1/2 yerba mate, 1/2 chamomile, iced, medium creamy with almond milk and light sweet with honey
- Iced Philtered Soul, straight up

It is the headquarters, so they test out new food items here. They had the ricotta & pistachio toast, which isn't something you can find at all the locations that serve food (not all locations have toast/food selections other than what you see in the bakery display case)!! 

The ricotta & pistachio toast was kinda missing something?? It was served on Starter Bakery bread and came with honey and sea salt, but it kinda lacked the flavor I was expecting?? It was tasty with a hint of sweet and salty that complemented each other nicely, but I think I'm going to stick to my usual: avocado toast with no egg

They had a creamy hazelnut toast on the menu, but I didn't see it in the display case, so I asked if they were still serving it, and the worker said they ran out of hazelnuts and that they stopped because it wasn't super popular :( I also saw a few energy bowl options!! Hella rad!!

Bottom line: Love this location!! The workers are super friendly, and there's tons of space if you're looking for a place to work. I'm a HUGEEE sucker for those cute little hip local third wave coffee shops with ambiguous names that leave much room for interpretation (SF's specialty!!!!!!!), but Philz will always be #1 in my heart
author: Kithumini J.

description:
Philz Coffee in dogpatch is a staple of this industrial neighborhood. The space has an open floor plan with high ceilings, well lit and plenty of workspace. It's typical to see several people working on their laptops and reading books at Philz. In addition to the wonderful workspace, wifi and kind staff members, the coffee is INCREDIBLE!!!!

For the coffee snob that is into PURE black coffee, Philz will not disappoint the highly developed palate of yours. My go-to is Aromatic Arabic. A darker blend with tones of walnut and a smokiness to it. No cream, no sugar needed. Just a good cup of coffee to get the caffeine surge you need for work, and wonderful taste to keep your soul happy. 

In addition, the breakfast burritos, banana nut bread and complementary cucumber water are frosting on the wonderful (coffee) cake that is Philz. 

Bottom Line: Best coffee in San Francisco.
author: Jaime W.

description: I absolutely love the Philz here. Beautiful and spacious interior to work, strong wifi, amazing service. Theres also tons of free parking around, which really puts the cherry on the top! It's one of my favorite coffee spaces in the city.
author: Ashley C.

description:
Get the Mediterranean avocado egg toast. It's served on a Starter bakery sourdough slice that's satisfyingly loaded with mashed avocado spread, avocado oil and spices.

All in all, this is my favorite Philz location - it's well-lit, spacious with high ceilings, bright windows, and is nested wonderfully in the artsy industrial area of the Dogpatch district.
author: Camille E.

description:
Unfortunately and unnecessarily long process. Spent 15 minutes waiting on a small coffee and it wasn't busy. 

Also unfortunate you can't add milk yourself as it must be steamed into the drink which creates froth I wasn't looking for. Chose "Julie's ultimate" dark roast but it's pretty light and mediocre sorry to say. 

Won't be back :-/
author: Molli W.

description: Excellent! A newer Philz that has it all down. A large enough space, enough staff, friendly and knowledgeable staff, all of the same coffee goodies that you expect but there's more - fooooood! I'm on a whole 30 diet at the moment so I had to skip it but next time I'd like to come back and try something on the menu. I can't wait to return.
author: Guisela L.

description: I've had fairly good experiences with this chain in the past, although I'm not a huge fan of other people adding the amendments to my coffee. This time I made my order and sat down. I waited for about 20 to 25 minutes and when I finally went back up to check on what was taking so long, they claimed that I never ordered anything. Wow. I was pretty much out of time, so I had to leave. Not a great experience. Pretty messed up of them to tell me to my face that I never ordered a coffee. Guess I was hallucinating.
author: Ted E.

description: This is definitely my favorite Philz location! Since HQ is right above (legit, you can see into the office), it's a great space with superstar staff. It has all the charm of the original location, but in a much more spacious Dogpatch warehouse. You can order your regular Philz coffee (I like to go for a Silken Splendor - yes, you can get different beans in 1 cup!) or try some of their newest inventions. Last week I tried a mint chocolate chip drink and it was basically a mint mojito + chocolate sprinkles - not my favorite, but still really good coffee. They've usually got good music going and there's plenty of space to get work done or catch up with friends - love it!
author: Ada C.

description:
TL;DR normal Philz, middle of nowhere in SF, near Dogpatch bouldering

I came here to get a quick caffeine fix before bouldering at Dogpatch a couple blocks away. There's some sketchy parking just a couple steps from Philz. Seems to be safe if you're just going in and out, but I'd be wary leaving my car out there for a long time. I usually get the minty drink, but this time I got the drip coffee something that tasted burnt. I think I'll stick with that minty drink. This is a super large space in the middle of nowhere in SF, everyone here was coding.
author: Sophia L.

description:
Shoutout to the hottie with the blue eyes who gave me a soft chocolate cookie!! and the lady who made my coffee was the sweetest! 

Coffee was delicious ~
author: Mila C.

description:
The staff here ROCKS. Everyone brings positive vibes to the shop *every single day* and it is SO awesome to work in a cafe where each person is contributing to a great experience. 

Coffee is stellar, and since this is HQ for Philz, you get the chance to try new, innovative things (depending on the promotion).

The long tables get filled up quickly because of how popular this place is, but definitely stop by and then tour the art gallery across the street with your coffee to enjoy the dogpatch area!
author: Jameson L.

description:
Yet another nice addition to "the" Dogpatch.

Great selection of coffee, chai lattes, mint tea. Nice grouping of food items (try the Ricotta on toast for example). Clean, modern, spacious. Indoor and outdoor seating. Really friendly staff. 

Got served quickly on a Sunday morning around 10:45. 

Very pleasant visit; will go back, probably quite often. Started recommending it to friends and neighbors immediately.
author: David G.

description:
Go to Philz in the Dogpatch almost every morning and can also get packed every morning, which can increase the wait time. 

To help with the wait, I started using the Caviar app to have a destined pick up time. Sometimes the app has an error where every items aren't available (tried new manhattan and canopy of heaven). The error prevented me from buying a handful of times, but I decided to call the actual store to see there was something they can do from their end.

Someone picked up and addressed my concern about the order. Went to the store 10-15 minutes later and my drink was ready with the name of the worker who I spoke with over the phone and who made my drink.

To Julia C., thank you for taking care of me!
author: Marvin P.

description:
Pros:
There were a lot of tables and couches, I was able to find a place to sit and study. The noise level was tolerable (given I was using headphones). The coffee menu was simple but satisfying. The avocado toast was also pretty tasty, a good amount of salt and avocado (with egg slices to balance the taste.) 

Cons:
There doesn't seem to be a lot of outlets, except on the large tables. The price of drinks and food were a bit on the higher end ($5 for coffee and $5.50 for a slice of avocado toast). 

I couldn't judge the wifi speed since I was on my xfinity hotspot, but it seems like you'll have to ask for a password just to login. Will go again for a good study spot!
author: Jessa May C.

description:
I am your biggest fan! Thank you Philz for knowing my name and my order when I come in! Now let's talk about the coffee: so I gave it five stars yup and I gave Starbucks five stars yup! 

Let me explain myself! It's all due to location!! No Philz in San Diego! So Starbucks it is! But when in the Bay! Philz I will stock you until forever!! And Pray for an opening in San Diego!

Hooked on Jacobs wonderbar sweet and creamy! This dark roast packs a punch, of energy and a fantastical taste of amazing grown coffee with just the right amount of sweet.

And the jam toast!! Fresh fruit preserve each morning honey! Thank you for getting me ready for work each morning! 

One con: when you use the app to order ahead, you. Can't order the toast! What's that about get that on the app so we can order and dash! Don't miss sales!!! But never the less I will ask you everyday I am in the Bay are you gonna get a location in San Diego! Hello snoops behind Philz are you gonna get a location in la? Lol
author: Misty N.

description: Love Philz coffee, this location is just always a hit or miss for me though. The last time I came around, the lady helping me didn't make my pour over fresh and used the grounds from the previous order because that person ordered the same coffee as me. Obviously could taste the difference in that. We all know how long pour overs take. We all who come to Philz are willing to wait the time, so why skip the step of just grounding another fresh cup for the next person? Lame. Also, when you order light cream, they still put waaaay too much cream. Probably won't be heading back to this specific location unless i'm in dire need.
author: Karen T.

description: The best cup of coffee you'll ever buy. High quality and high customer service. Worth the wait!
author: Mary M.

description: Every time I come here it's never crazy with long lines. Staffs are great with great big smiles on their faces. Who wants to go get coffee to encounter grumpy people. I mean, you're already grumpy because you didn't get your coffee yet and you have to deal with grumpy people is no bueno! Sometimes I go to SB and the baristas there are so grumpy. Why go to SB when I can go to Philz and they have on that big smile and even have time to ask how I like the way they make my coffee.  There's this one guy that always ask you how you like it and if you say I like it he'll say "Nailed it!". How awesome is that! Love this location!! Will I come back? Of course!!
author: Susan H.

description:
I'm not a coffee person at all. I actually don't even drink coffee but I would come here just for the mint mojito iced coffee. This is the only thing I've ever tried here and I like the presentation. I enjoy how they leave it uncapped and place the mint so perfectly on top. It takes some mixing for the coffee to be good because it's usually sweeter on the bottom of the cup. 

I also really like the vibe of this location. It seemed very hipster and there were a lot of people working with their laptops. Pretty spacious area that would be useful for studying or working. It was quite packed for a Saturday afternoon.
author: Annie H.

description:
Great coffee, great service with plenty of seating (both inside and out) and a great staff!!! 
It would be great if they open 30 minutes earlier, so I could grab one on my way to work every morning, haha...
author: Kevin S.

description:
Philz coffee is always a hit.
This this location is in an industrial area. I couldn't really find parking and besides down the street.
The inside of this coffee shop is fairly big and has plenty of seating inside and out.
The staff was very friendly like always.
I ordered a iced mint mojito. I really enjoyed it. I recommend getting it sweet and creamy.
author: Kevin S.

description:
And the award for the best interior design for a philz coffee goes to this location! This philz coffee is unique because it has a lounge area with couches and shared tables. There's even an upstairs!

My barista was hilarious and very chirpy. I ordered a mint mojito (basic) and a hot chocolate for my sister. I wanted mines to be hot since I didn't like the iced version I got at another location. When I got my drink he messed up and gave me an ice mint mojito. I tasted it and omg it was so goooood. It was sweet and creamy like he had described in the beginning. I didn't even bother to get it exchanged for a hot one because the iced one he made was perfect!

Seating was difficult to find especially for two because it was a bit packed, but my sister and I found a place at the end of one of the long tables. We just had to move a chair to the end of the table. Nothing wrong with the workers and the layout, but some customers need learn how to share in an open space and to not hogg up chairs.
author: Grace Z.

description: Philz is definitely better than starbucks. I am addidicted to coffee and I only find star bucks coffee to be, ugh, average. Philz coffee is better than average in my opnion. Yeah, but are not perfect nothing mind blowing or anything, but well, at least it's a cup of good coffee isnt it?
author: Lori G.

description:
Wow. THis place is a rare gem and find.  While waiting for someone. It's a great haven. 
Damian and Alice helped me they were SUPER helpful and friendly.  Id tried Philz before but it was never this good nor did it turn my head.  This place has ambiance all the comforts of home. Greta food. Huge coffee variety. Friendly staff and its home to the Philz University!
I will be back.
author: David C.

description:
Corporate HQ/ coffee store at this location. Why isn't it that I'm working for philz already? Serisouly so obsessed with this place and am so happy my office is 2 mins from this location. I'm gonna go broke because of philz. 

Had the avocado toast with hard boiled egg on top and it was amazing. Toast was soft and avocado was so good. They also sell banh mi here and fruits with Sriracha salt on the side. Like, omg!! Am I in orange county right now? This is everything I love in one place. Aaahhh!!!
author: Caitlin P.

description:
Beautiful open space with gobs of natural lighting, big tables, fast wifi, abundant power outlets, and plentiful parking all around.. what's not to like?

I mean sure, their coffee isn't quite as good as Four Barrel, Sightglass, Contraband, Artis, Blue Bottle, etc but damn do they overload your taste buds with their Mint Mojito Iced Coffee.. It's definitely my guilty pleasure drink when I want to throw caution to the wind.
author: Henry W.

description:
I know, I know...yet ANOTHER Philz review.  What can I say?  The love is real, but how could I not write about this one?  Not only is it the newest Philz in SF, but it's also the mothership, home to both Philz's HQ/office space and Philz University!  Consider this paying homage to the awesomeness that is Philz.

While it lacks the funkier nature and vibe of the original Philz, it has the more modern and contemporary design of the newer Philz locations that I like so much (San Mateo, Redwood City, Palo Alto).  It's pretty cool to be able to look up and see light fixtures that spell out "Cup of Love", as well as the Philz offices on the second floor (looks like they took over/converted the garage and bottom floor of the building)  

As for the drinks, my Mint Mojito may have been crafted by a "student" of Philz University, but it was just as good as any other I've had.  Just the right amount of sweetness with just the right amount of creaminess.  Of course, being able to snag a seat outside made the experience that much more enjoyable.  Perhaps not many people have discovered this location just yet (it's a relatively quiet street off 3rd), but there's also plenty of seating both inside and out (with plenty of outlets too).

If all of that wasn't enough to make this Philz the best one in SF, the fact that it's in Potrero Hill helps.  Talk about the perfect fit!  Not only has the area needed a Philz, but parking is a breeze (unlike their other locations).  Spaces are somewhat limited on the other side of the street (there are several large driveways), but there are plenty of spots nearby.  Given how rare easy parking is in SF, that alone makes this Philz worth coming back to.
author: Mike L.

description:
Great pour over coffee. Very large & open coffee house, with lots of seating inside & outside. Parking in this area is now extremely challenging, but if you make it there, you'll love it. Great food too. Phil is usually around and the staff is pretty chill. (Some dudes get a lil overly excited & obnoxiously loud sometimes, but overall these folks are great. Lol)
Gotta love the Iced Mint Mojitos!
author: JonJon W.

description:
We drop in here every once and awhile for a quick tea and a chat in the sunshine!

The service is warm and friendly, and the tea tends to be made quicker here over my local Philz. I also love the outdoor seating, there's quite a bit of it and usually there's a free table.

This isn't the Philz locale to go if you drive in the city, because parking is scarce, but there's a cute little garden area around the corner if you want to take your tea on the road.

All in all, quite a wonderful little location!
author: Meg T.

description:
What can I say about Philz that hasn't already been said already? We are visiting from Idaho and if we could pack this whole joint up on our backs and take it with us, we would. 

Where do I start? Bangin' avo toast and bagels. Scrumptious coffee (we tried the decaf Ethiopian and the iced Mint Mojito). Bright, open work spaces. Super nice people. Laptop friendly. And a steady stream of old-ish R&B from Destiny's Child to Mariah Carey to Rhianna to Justin Timberlake to Usher (it took all I had in me not to break into the dance sequence from the Yeah! music video). 

Periodically when it gets busy you hear, "Everyone! We love you! We want to serve you coffee! Hang in there and we'll get everyone taken care of!" or hoots and hollers that I can only suspect are caffeine-induced. Everyone here is happy and I can tell that Philz must take care of its employees. Not only that, but the internet was fast enough for me to complete work that I needed to do before we left SF. 

I will miss you, Philz. But I'll always have memories of your avo toast, your dope jamz, and your delicious coffee!
author: Maria R.

description: Ecstatic is my favorite! It's perfectly sweet and creamy for me but you can adjust everything to your liking. I keep coming back to this location because of its convenient location. I can always find street parking right in front of the place.
author: Grace M.

description:
If I could give 5.5 stars I would. This is probably my 5th 5 star Philz review but this location is the best!

It is huge with plenty of places to sit and do work. 2 stories, although I don't know if we can go upstairs. It also has delectable looking food to munch on, free and easy to use wifi, and of course the best coffee.

I always order the mint mojito iced or philtered soul hot or iced.
author: Corinna T.

description:
I've done Philz on Van Ness, I've done Philz on 24th Street, & now I've done Philz on Minnesota.  

Here's what I have deduced...

Do you like your coffee rushed?

Do you like your coffee prepared in batches?

Do you like your coffee potentially old & stale?

If you've answered yes to any or all of these questions, then Philz is not for you.

I gotta be honest, I love Starbucks.  They do my matcha green tea latte w soy & no sweetener to perfection.  But just like in other areas of life, a girl cannot live on Starbucks alone.

Philz is always warm & welcoming.  And delivery of product?  Straight up impressive.  The baristas take the time & cultivate the art of giving you a supreme cuppa joe...Every.Single.Time.  Every single cup is made to order!  Yes, it might take 5 or 10 minutes.  But it's all for you!  And you just can't rush perfection.

This time, I ordered my mint mojito hot instead of iced for the first time.  Know what?  It's just as friggin good hot as it is iced?!  Maybe even better...?  I lived...& I learned.

We all know their tag line by now...
"One cup at a time." 

Thank you Phil, for making our coffee one cup at a time.

It's a beautiful thing.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Really the last thing that Philz needs is another 5-star review boasting about its space, its coffee quality, its baritas, etc! I like this Philz because of the street parking availability and the well-lit open feel space. 

My go to? The Mint Mojito with reduced sweetness, sub almond milk. I will say that I appreciate there is no extra charge to sub almond milk. I also appreciate the craftsmanship of the baristas into making it just right, every single time. Thanks Phil! Now just waiting for a Philz to open somewhere in Marin. :)
author: Liz C.

description: Philz manages to be serious about coffee without being inhospitable. They specialize in custom blends of coffee which are made by pour-over "one cup at a time." They also have a wide assortment of quality baked goods, including avocado toast, for the decadent. In addition, they have parking, comfortable seating, WiFi, plenty of outlets, and a tolerable volume level, which are not so easy to come by in San Francisco.
author: David L.

description: By far the best Philz in San Francisco!  I come here often to get some work done away from home. Lots of tables and other people taking their time with their coffee or working.  One time I forgot my wallet, tried to pay with Apple Pay with no success. The lady was nice enough to give this preggo mama her decaf Sumatra.  Forever a loyal customer right here!
author: Iris Corine B.

description: A coffee lover will enjoy the spacious, open areas to sit and sip a hot cup. The open fronts and high ceiling invites you to enter and venture out wherever the coffee takes you. Top honors for the staff's energy. It's contagious. The vibe, the music, all of it today makes me glad that I stopped in.
author: Carlos F.

description: This is my local Philz.  I feel like I'm known here as the picky b**** who wants the lightest amount of cream in her coffee.  I'm the re-make girl.  Some people would just take the coffee as is, but I do not compromise.  This Philz puts up with my snobby light cream vibe and I thank them for it.  This is the best Philz in the city, IMO.
author: Melly O.

description:
Pluses all around for this Philz locale.

+ Spacious. Love the high ceiling. We're in the dogpatch which is a sunnier side of San Francisco so the ceiling high windows make for fabulous light.
+ Toasts with scrumptious flavors such as almond butter, honey, and salt and avocado and zatar! No other Philz location I know of serves these. I guess they offer them here since Philz HQ is located on the second floor of the cafe.
+ Friendly, smiley baristas. Philz is known for this but the ones here seem extra smiley and jovial. Maybe that's a pre-requisite for working at the corporate HQ store.
+ Not as crowded. I was hanging out here all day Thursday and there were lots of good seats to pick from and nary a long line or if it did get long, it went by pretty quickly.
+Clean - I frequent Philz a lot and depending on which area of SF you're in, some are way grungier than others. This one they actually take the time to wipe down the tables and the bathroom wasn't scary.

Was enjoying my weekday off here. Great environment to get super caffeinated (Currently having some heart palpitations -  strong brew today!), bring your laptop and get some stuff done. Decent wifi and good mix of music. Love the selection of people who frequent this Philz, from nearby office workers to police officers, construction workers, and a smattering of hipsters (one specifically who had the most enviable man bun that put my bun to shame.) Mad props to him. It was impeccable.
author: Kathleen S.

description: Great offerings like any other philz. Same place different location. Great location hard to find parking
author: Meishi M.

description:
I've never been much of a coffee person but we had an hour to kill waiting for our table at Aina and figured a warm beverage would do the trick in the meantime. This Philz location seems bigger and more open than the others I've been to. I usually order the Mint Mojito iced coffee but given that it was a cold morning, I decided to try Mocha Tesora instead.

My date wanted Ecstatic Coffee (but not iced) and they were able to accommodate his custom request. After getting our drinks, we sat at a long communal table and chatted. Many people were working on their laptops; others were relaxing on the couches. I enjoyed the laid back vibe of this location.
author: Yi Z.

description:
Great location in dog patch area !! 

I came here after climbing to pick up a mint mojito iced coffee and was greeted by the most friendliest barista ever. He was so accommodating and welcoming and smiley ! 

I ordered a large mint mojito iced coffee but there was some miscommunication so he made me another one on the house. He totally did not have to do that but he did which I really appreciated. Mint mojio iced coffee is my go to drink here, it is very creamy though and I also like my pretty sweet so it isn't a drink I can drink all the time. 

 The layout of this philz is also beeeeeeyootifful. Plenty of seating open concept, bright and airy super large windows and I think? Upstairs seating ? 

Cannot wait to come here again, probably gonna start trying other drinks like the mocha tesoro.
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
This is an amazing gem in the middle of semi industrial zone. Our office is not that far away so I come here a bit. 

The space is open and delightful and the drinks are always great in any location. 

Have a meeting or bring a friend.
author: Mike B.

description:
Cool spot. Parking is always available. The weather here in dogpatch is great, too. Huge location; their offices are upstairs.

Mint mojito + avocado toast = best breakfast! 

This location is my favorite because of the space, ample parking, and it's always sunny!
author: Alice T.

description:
I am really liking this Philz location:  open space, lots of tables for work, not so crowded, friendly staff, and more FOOD items to go with my Soooo Good (or Mint Mojito, depending on my mood that day).  

Even though it is not the one I frequent the most, for convenience reasons, but to do work or hangout... this would be at the top of my Philz Preference list.
author: Lyn C.

description:
BEST PHILZ BRANCH! I've been to most of the philz in the bay, and the layout here is pretty unique and amazing. It's pretty quiet in this area of the dogpatch so I'm glad I found this secret gem in the crazy city. The lines also don't go around the corner like the philz next to the sf caltrain station, and I can actually get a seat on the weekend (the best!). Their decorations are also very homey/hipsterish. 

I switch up my order every time, but for the sweet options, I like their mint mojitos. I also get the philtered soul and green tea. As for food, they have AVOCADO TOAST!! I haven't seen this food option at any other philz, so I get this pretty regularly. Plus, the staff are super pleasant and helpful. If you don't know what to order, just ask any one of the employees and they'd be happy to help. Sure, it's a bit pricy, but it's definitely worth, especially since I come here and study basically all weekend. They'll probably have later hours if the demand picks up though. Dogpatch is def an up-and-coming area of sf!
author: Connie L.

description:
Glad I discovered this Philz! Coffee and treats are consistently excellent in every spot, but this Philz also has their 'handmade' treats like avocado toast and toast with almond butter / honey. YES PLEASE!

Even if you're a regular black coffee drinker, I would recommend trying a lightly sweet and/or creamy Philz concoction at least once. I like the Silken Splendor or a blend of Swiss Water Peru/Aromatic Arabic for less caffeine. The baristas generally have good recommendations as well. Stop by if you're in the area!

This location is also a favorite for the environment. I can appreciate the earlier stores for their authentic feel, but for a study spot or coffee date I prefer the newer locations for more spacious seating and better lighting. It's just more comfortable. Another bonus is that you can drive and park nearby, a rarity in SF!
author: Connie Q.

description: I am a motherf'cker fan of this place, good lord I'm addicted and I'm not even a huge coffee drinker. I go between So Good and Dancing water. Yum
author: Samantha S.

description:
What it lacks in the typical funky vibe of Philz shops, it more than makes up for with a view that can't be beat (but bring a jacket, because this is SF on the water after all).

If you haven't been to Philz before, be patient as your cup is being handcrafted to perfection, and as if you were ordering a bottle of wine at a nice restaurant, you'll be asked to try it to make sure it's exactly what you're looking for. No, they don't do lattes with Splenda and all those complicated drinks you can get at The Bucks, but tell the barista what you're looking for (coffee flavor profile, sweetness and cream levels) and you won't be disappointed.

Whether you're a tourist on a rental bike to the Golden Gate or a local taking a stroll along the Marina Green, stop and treat yo self. You deserve a wonderful Iced Mint Mojito or another Philz concoction of love.
author: Cristina S.

description:
Excellent service. Some of the nicest baristas I've ever met. They'll ask you if they've served the coffee up to your expectations and if it's not strong enough or lacks something, they really try their best to make it perfect for you!

Had the mint mojito and friend had the mocha tesora. Really good coffee with fantastic fresh flavors. They use Ghirardelli chocolate for the mocha tesora! This coffee truck is stationed in the middle of the Marina next to fort mason and the palace of fine arts. It's the perfect location to enjoy a cup of joe. What more can I say about it? It's perfect!
author: Sandra L.

description:
If you're looking for a plain vanilla latte, you're not going to find that here. Instead of your usually blah, Philz has got a small menu filled with unique speciality drinks like their mint Mojito iced coffee. 

They serve their iced coffee in hot drink cups, which is a little strange but whatever. I ordered the mint Mojito iced coffee. The flavor itself was DELICIOUS. I've never had a better tasting coffee. BUT I can not get over how many freaking mint leaves were in my drink. I'm talking stem and leaf all up in there. Each sip had a leaf, which made it so hard to drink. I'd love to get it again but I definitely would have to ask for no leaves! I do not want a jungle in my mouth. 

Other than that, I love the unique flavor of this coffee. I can tell there is a lot of caffeine in it cause I was already tripping after a few sips. Great taste (just no leaves)
author: Courtney O.

description: Came here for my weekly stop.  I got the mojito iced coffee and it was refreshing.  They also had spiced pumpkin latte and that was delicious if you like pumpkin spice.  I also tried my friends tavosa blend which is the most popular and the smoothness spoke for the quality.
author: Ana B.

description:
THIS IS WHERE THE MAGIC HAPPENS.

It's Philz Coffee HQ! Not as magical as the OG store in Mission but close enough.  They've got cup(s) of love... literally.... it's spelled out on the ceiling!

The coolest part is that this is the location of Philz University, Philz office, and Philz coffee all in one. The first floor is the coffee shop along with Philz University located in the back and then upstairs leads into the Philz office, complete with conference rooms and everything. The coffee here is just as good as any location if not better ;) Rumor has it (I heard it from the CEO) that this where they test try some new things before rolling out to the rest of the stores :)

I love the vibe of this place, it's a little bit more modern than most stores and it's got plenty of seating. It's bright, vibrant, and has plenty of natural lighting thanks to the glass windows. The staff is super friendly and it's the only place I feel like I can be really picky with my drink and the barista isn't going roll their eyes at me or want to spit in my drink :) It's kind of located in the middle of nowhere (at least to me) but there's plenty of street parking! 

Coffee Recommendation: Philtered Soul (iced), adjust sweetness and creaminess level to your liking. yumminess in a cup :D
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I've been going to the original Philz on 24th st for over 10 years now. I've been to most of the Philz locations in all the cities that he's popping up in, Oakland, SJ, Palo Alto, etc. I don't usually bother to write reviews for each one because the Philz chain is beginning to look and function all the same. Not bad, just not worth me putting pen to paper over.

Well, my usual 24th st. Philz has been going downhill lately. Ever Since Tony, the pourista left, the coffee just hasn't been the same. When I saw this new out of the way Philz pop up under "Hot and New" I figured I would jump in the car to check it out. 

This Philz is located in an up and coming yuppieville area of the Dogpatch. It's located on the southern end of it that hasn't yet caught up. With that said, it's located in a brand new condo/loft complex, surrounded by nothing but industrial buildings. There's decent parking but not as much as I would've thought since most of the would be parking spaces are driveways.

It's a hot looking new space, as all the new Philz are. However there's something different about this one. It could be the Neon "Philz University" sign and bar located to the left of the main brew line. I assume this is where they train budding pouristas. There's even a snazzy glass conference room upstairs with a massive TV. I'm sure nobody has trouble staying awake during long training sessions here.

I was joking with a coworker that maybe we would run into Tony here. Sure enough, when we walked in we were instantly greeted with his patented "gentleman, what can I get you today?". Holy shit! Phil must know Tony is his best pourista, so he brought him down to Philz U to train the n00bs. Smart use of Snoop's money, Phil. Very smart! 

He brewed up a fantastic cup of coffee, Silken Splendor on this occasion. Steeped perfectly, aerated multiple times, double high poured, then filled to the brim in our own mugs which saves you a dollar by bringing your own.

Their pastry case was well stocked, although I hate their Starter bakery items, I was happy to see they had several varieties of Pepples Donuts. More Vegan items would be much appreciated. 

Even if I have to drive here, I just found my new Philz to begin Phunky Phat Phridays.
author: John B.

description: Mint Mojito hits the perfect spot. Interior is nice and spacious with Wi-Fi. Employees are also helpful and friendly!
author: Lina T.

description:
My 1st philz ever! 
I'm 8 months pregnant and I've been craving a good cup of joe... The barista Matthew was so sweet, friendly, and knowledgeable. I had no idea what to order but I knew I wanted something sweet. He whipped up a decaf mint mojito on the sweeter side. Yummmmmmyyyyyy!!!!

Of course, I needed something to pair my drink with and the young lady taking orders for food was just as friendly and sweet. She paired me up with a creamy jam toast.  Yummmmmmmmyyyyy! 

Thank you both for confirming what the hype was all about at Philz- Not only was my cup of joe UH-MAZING but the experience, service, and warm welcome was as well. 

Oh and thank you for supporting our men and women in blue!

CHARLIE COMPANY
author: Betsy C.

description:
I LOVE THIS PHILZ!!!! This is my absolute favorite location. Parking is tricky but I always find a spot. It's huge, with plenty of outlets, space to do work, and of course -- tip top coffee! I love it here! 

My ONLY complaint is that it's difficult to get work done when I keep hearing "NAILED IT!" every 5 minutes :( Love all my baristas but I think it's very distracting to the customers!
author: M J.

description:
Dear Philz,

I love you so much but this location is funny. Almost every single time I've ordered they get my coffee order wrong. I don't know if it's because it's so early in the morning and everyone is still half asleep but I think it's weird. I ask for iced I get hot, I ask for small I get large (which would be a plus for me but I'm pregnant so I can't drink it anyway) I ask for decaf I get regular, I mean the list goes on. My order is super simple, small philtered soul, iced, sweet and creamy, extra creamy. Maybe I need to speak really loud so they can hear me? I'm not sure but it's disappointing because a good cup of coffee in the morning is why I choose Philz over Starbucks. The people that work there are very nice, just wish my order would get done correctly. :'o(
author: Jay S.

description: Perfectly located in the Marina park and a great stop for a coffee break before biking to Crissy Fields and the Golden Gate bridge. Love their mint mojito iced coffee!
author: Jam C.

description: First time here and love the vibe.  Visiting from SD and so happy that they are opening up in SD.  Got a ambrosia coffee of the god...  loved it
author: Dee F.

description:
I would rather pay 4 buks at philz($3 for a small, but cmon no one gets a small) than at Starbucks or peets. This is drip coffee made at its best. there iced drinks on a hot day is what makes them one of the best if anything. but we all know the philz is great. lets talk about this location. 

This place is the Phillz HQ, so this is where the magic happens, the location is dressed up like a boutique with light on the ceiling spelling out cup of love, which what you feel when the servers serve you the most amazing cup of java that you prob have ever tasted. they have a few tables, sofa and even board games for ppl to just chill and sip you coffee. 

It just a great place to hangout and have a great cup of joe.
author: Anuj C.

description: Excellent pour-over coffee with a large selection. Some pastry items are also available. It's relatively quiet and has some comfy couches and chairs. Fantastic coffee and great service. Food is great too. A little expensive and gets crowded.
author: Callen H.

description: They had pretty nice coffee and cake, and I had a great little chat with the staff while they made it. It's a pretty cool space they have there too.
author: Sean D.

description: I am absolutely so ecstatic that this Philz opened up. Got there at 11am for the soft opening and it wasn't too busy. All the people working there had so much energy and were quite happy. The location is pretty big though for a coffee shop and there are tables and sofas to sit at. The bar is quite large. I wonder if they'll have that many baristas working there all at once. Great opening though. They were giving away free coffee and pastries for everyone. Also pretty cool that this is their new HQ, so you can see all the offices upstairs. I'm excited to return back here later when things aren't so crazy. Drinks were great as usual.  I'm curious how busy this location will be during normal hours. Overall, as a Philz fan, this place is just wonderful.
author: Julie L.

description:
Uniquely SF coffee shop.  Run by people who care with innovative drink offerings.  This location is particularly cool b/c its the HQ for Philz and you can see the office workers, some with hilarious standing desks and large heads, slogging away while the real workers are making your drinks.

They don't do lattes here but you can get something just as delicious if you're into that kind of thing - just ask one of their friendly baristas.  My go to is Ecstatic Iced Coffee or the hazelnut flavored Philtered Soul.
author: Ben S.

description: It's spacious and welcoming.  I love how bright the space is.  It takes a while to pick up, but they do a good job in optimizing their process by having you order first then pay, so you're not slowed down by the long line at the cashier.  The ginger snap iced coffee was goooood.  Lol.  The honey almond butter toast looked delish.  Next time...
author: Melinda Y.

description: Excellent coffee!  Strong and varied flavors. Hipster crowd. Fast wi-fi. Cool free museum across the street.
author: Jingo Django J.

description:
How can you give less than 5 stars to a Philz Coffee?!

This is a quirky little spot out in boonieville, but it happens to be at the Philz Headquarters. It looks like a tech start up upstairs, and the downstairs is a open floor plan that serves coffee. I don't see this location getting as packed as the downtown ones, but thats what makes it so awesome. You can pop in and out and be on the go.

They also sell more pastries than some of the other locations, however I felt like they should not sell the burritos. It was bland, with no flavor, and almost $6. Granted they don't make it there, they shouldn't even offer it.

Regardless, they make a mean cup of coffee, and the accept order ahead orders at this location which makes it a breeze to get caffeinated!
author: Bevi K.

description:
the space is like workshop's cafe except you don't. have. to. pay.

amazing.
author: Michelle C.

description: Love this spot. Gorgeous decor, great workspaces, and less busy than the other Philz locations. I just wish they would offer ceramic mugs, it's a huge impact to send this many cups straight into the landfill. (But I do like the discount I get for bringing my own reusable mug!) In good weather, the patio is full-sun gorgeous until early afternoon, if you can stand the cacophony of construction noise from across the street. Though to be fair the music inside is almost as loud - though at least it's good music. All around, five stars.
author: Be F.

description:
Love Philz!!!! Just discovered their truck at The Marina Green park.
Have a coffee and then explore Fort Mason, Crissy Field, the Marina District, and the Presidio with a convenient cup of love!
Hours are 8-5 weekends and hours will expand with longer days!
Support your local quality small businesses!
Cheers!!!
author: Sean M.

description:
nice big open space. lots of study room and tables.

Much nicer than the downtown sf locations but its tucked away in the corner of some industrial area near dogpatch. but thanks to yelp and gmaps it was easy to find and with parking.

this Philz is a win!!
author: Sam C.

description:
Within walking distance to work, I am definitely going to get ultra-caffeinated on a daily basis.

This location is very well hidden.  One would not notice it if you don't pay enough attention.  It is huge, clean, and spacious.  Menu option is the same as other locations.

Downside:  SQ register system does not report to AMEX or Visa the charge as a restaurant; there goes my double points :(
author: Chi T.

description: Love this location. This is my first time at the location. This location rocks. This location reminds me of the Berkeley location on 9th street. I hope to be back here soon. I am glad that there is a Philz Coffee location in the Dogpatch neighborhood.
author: Isaac H.

description:
I gave up coffee recently to sleep better. I still frequent Philz for their Philz bagels. Bagels suck in SF generally, but prepped the Philz way (lightly toasted, cream cheese, sliced cucumbers & tomatoes) they can be quite delicious.

This location is big with plenty of hangout spots (couches, communal tables, outdoor seating in sunny Dogpatch). Much more mellow due to location, but with Philz friendliness still.
author: Rina W.

description: What an awesome place! You see, I love love LOVE a REALLY LOUD coffee shop in the morning playing the 80's tunes so freakin LOUD that you can't even understand what the barista is asking you. I think it's SO cool that they make it even LOUDER by screaming and yelling over the top of the music, calling out the orders and yelling at each other, bangin pots around and bursting out in crazy fun LOUD laughter! Wow they are having such a GREAT LOUD time in there! What an awesome place to sit and try and read or maybe get some work done! We all love to read and concentrate when the music is so FREAKIN LOUD you can't even hear yourself think! If I could give extra stars for the extra decibels and the blood dripping down my earlobes, I would! GREAT JOB GUYS! I WON'T BE BACK!
author: Jd J.

description:
Great energy. Great customer service. 
Phillz never disappoints. I'm glad we have some real coffee in the hood.
author: Zain E.

description:
I know all their coffee is the same, but this is where I went, so I'll just put the review here.

I think this place would be fine if they just removed "coffee" from their name. Although this was the first time I had a sip of their coffee and didn't immediately pour it out after the first sip, I still bristle at their "secret" blends. First of all, their light roasts are actually just short of burnt. I can't imagine what their medium and dark roasts are. And not telling you what beans are in the coffee is like telling me, "You'll enjoy this wine. We won't tell you what it is, but just that it tastes like pineapple".

Philz is fine if you like to mask the bad coffee beans with sugar and cream. Me, I actually like the flavor of coffee. But, at least my regret is no longer increasing with each visit.
author: masa s.

description: The customer service was amazing I was blown away! I will be frequenting here more often!
author: Amanda F.

description:
I can't even. Coffee from Seattle should taste like this.

Saw someone's iced mint mojito on IG and HAD to try one. It's so creamy and fresh, and even came with fresh mint garnish! 

Our drinks took a few minutes to make, but we had time and it was sunny. Aaaaand I'd rather have slow fresh delicious coffee than quick crap. I'll be back next time I'm in SF.
author: Alaina W.

description:
Ahh the cuteness.

Decent drip, usual suspects at your disposal: brown sugar, white sugar, equal, unequal, honey, agave.

 You get the idea.
author: Christine T.

description:
I really was hoping to taste some amazing delicious super fine sexy coffee during my recent visit to San Francisco and after my first sip of Philz Coffee I was like "Mission Completed!" 

I ordered an iced Mocha Tesora & it was delicious! Can not say one bad thing. Absolutely delicious!
author: Halisa V.

description:
The best cup of coffee you will ever have.
Beats star bucks and petes.
Also the staff is so friendly and they ask you to try the cup of coffee before you leave.  
If you don't like they will remake the cup of coffee. 

Thumbs up
author: Ron S.

description: This is my favorite Philz in SF. The space is HUGE which makes it really easy to find a table or couch to study on (#lawschoolproblems). Everyone who works there is always extraordinarily friendly- and there's (usually) always street parking!
author: Maddi W.

description: Definitely one of my go to coffee places. I'd take philz coffee or Starbucks any day. This location is very nice and has friendly staff. I was there opening day and have been meaning to post a review about this place.  The area is very low key and the location is somewhat hidden away which makes it a nice get away location. I definitely recommend going here.
author: Arias D.

description: Philz Coffee stands in its own. love this location. open, roomy. sometimes the other locs get crowded while waiting for your drink
author: Kilo B.

description:
As far as I know, coffee at each Philz is pretty comparable, so this is a review primarily on the particulars of this location.

First things first, my fave drink here is the Mint Mojito...I know, basic. But hey, it's sweet and caffeinated and refreshing :)

I love that they have so many food options at this location. Because this location is the home of Philz HQ, they have many pilot food items that are not available at the other locations (yet?).The avocado toast is TO DIE FOR. I don't know what they put on it aside from the olive oil, but it's so delicious. And this is in addition to the normal deliciousness of avos in general.

The baristas are always friendly and upbeat here, and they do a good job of keeping the cafe clean. The cafe itself has a start-up office kind of feel. Maybe because of the demographic, idk. If you stay for a while, there will be occasional influxes of tech bros and the type. The space itself is airy, inviting, and really bright. My favorite place to sit is by the window, but there are also couches in the middle of the room, as well as long tables.

The atmosphere of this Philz is great if you just want a place to chill and maybe get some work or reading done. That's what I've been using it for the past few weekends!
author: Denise C.

description: Loved my "Cup of Love" The gingersnap iced coffee was amazing and the people were very personal and welcoming! If I am ever back in this area this is where I will be stopping!
author: Victoria S.

description: Lots of open space, friendly staff. I think this is one of the best Philz in the city. I love you Philz!
author: Emily M.

description:
After a long afternoon at Ft. Mason, stumbling across this Philz Coffee truck was a godsend. 

I'm not going to tell you about how good their drinks are and my affinity for their iced mint mojito, because you already know. What I will say is that service here was fast and done with a smile. Just as much love and detail goes into every cup of coffee here just as at their other locations. 

Also, this Philz truck is probably the only good thing about the Marina ;P
author: Stephanie C.

description: Many options to sit, chill, connect and work. Definitely city vibe, loft feel. Super spacious, lots of natural light, roll up doors. Nice staff and the reason it all began, my solid Tesora :)
author: Desiree G.

description: LOVE this Philz. I come very week and I always get the ice ecstatic coffee- sweet and creamy. The baristas always make it to perfection. The atmosphere in this coffee shop is awesome, and the staff is so friendly and approachable. They only have one bathroom, but they do a great job of keeping it clean. This place has great customer service, and has a lot of room to get work done.
author: Barbara C.

description: In theory a great place to work with good coffee. In practice, this one barista (with an admittedly righteous beard and ponytail) shouts like a banshee the entire time you're trying to get shit done. I think the person controlling the music tries to overshadow him with power-driving Whitney Houston tunes, albeit to no avail.
author: Ted M.

description:
I recently visited my sister in the city and she brought me to Philz  and I have never had a better experience. Everyone was so friendly and helpful and really passionate about service and quality. The iced green tea I had was delicious, the mint mojito was so unique and refreshing, the chocolate croissant was chocolatey - all around memorable. The best part was the avocado toast, which I topped with hot sauce. It was insanely good - the bread was just the right toastiness, avocado piled high, minimal mess potential, salt, pepper, olive oil, hot sauce - I'd gladly fly across the US for these guys. They are really doing something right, here.
Much love.
author: Julie S.

description: My work travels have happliy had me in the creative SF Dogpatch, Central Waterfront neighborhood these past few weeks. I try to visit Philz as much as I am able to. Yesterday, I finally "got it" - took a moment to relax, walked around and viewed the colorful artwork, displayed on the walls, while waiting for my delicious "Mint Mojito" iced coffee to be made. I also ordered and enjoyed the Flower Child Almond & coconut mile lavender infused yogurt with candied citrus peel & pistachio granola. The music was great - it gave me a few moments to unwind and "chill." I appreciated the experience and delicious treats.
author: Jeni P.

description: How much do I love dogpatch Philz? So much. Beautiful light filled space on a quiet street. Very nice staff, great food (especially the green chili burrito). Tons of outlets and space to work. Good music. You can spend the day here being super productive and very well caffeinated and fed.
author: Sarah P.

description:
+ Spacious colorful spot
+Lots of power outlets 
+Free Wifi 
+Tasty drinks (but of course)
+Street parking available (easy to find a spot)
author: Monica R.

description:
I LOVE this location. It's spacious, there are plenty of seats and outlets, high ceilings, and the amount of natural light streaming into this place creates a airy environment that feels completely different from the den-like cozy location on 24th. 

Board games, stuffed Totoro animals to add some flair, cucumber water, adorable lighting fixtures spelling out words, gorgeous Bloom bouquets placed throughout, and great, friendly staff - this place has it all. Oh and did I mention that parking is a breeze?

My only gripe is that my iced coffee has tasted pretty darn watered down every time. It's happened both with the normal Ecstatic and the Philtered Soul. Hm, perhaps it's hitting the ice when it's still too hot? My theory is that other locations generally have a huge line - thus the baristas make a number of drinks at once. My coffee has time to cool before it's poured over ice. 

At this location, you often get some sweet one-on-one attention, but this also means that they want to get you your drink asap, and your coffee hits the ice when it's still fairly warm - thus creating a more watered-down drink. Definitely just a theory, someone correct me if I'm wrong.
author: Jessica O.

description: Love the open space here. The large menu is really hard to check out when you're order at the barista, so try the tiny menu next to each barista.
author: Vince H.

description:
Yes, as good as it gets. 

All the staff members here are really friendly and helpful. It's also a great space for working or for taking a break with your co-workers. Comfy couches and lots of tables (indoors and outdoors).  

Tip: If you don't like waiting in long lines for Philz like many of the other locations, come to this location. There's also a small public garden nearby -- great for a coffee break.
author: Bev M.

description:
Staff is friendly - even on Memorial Day when we were all working - and really really good at making coffee...i love all the baristas here and I love how there is a such a diverse and unique group of people working together.

Been to this new location almost everyday since they opened and I couldn't be more thrilled to have this operation so close to work. The location is beautiful, spacious, and warm - despite its lofty feel. There are always fresh flowers and honestly, I almost immediately feel awake just as I walk in! A few of the baristas already know my name and what I order. It's just a lovely way to start the day.

That being said - unless you are looking to be up all night dancing or studying, I suggest to stop drinking this coffee at 10am. Seriously, you WILL be fully awake, eyes wide open, in bed if you decide on an afternoon coffee here. Cutoff is 10am. trust me.

Good stuff!
author: nina B.

description:
I really enjoy Philz but their format is so flipping inconsistent. Yes, they ask you to try us and make sure it's how you want it, but no matter what adjectives I use to describe the amount of milk and sugar I'd like, every barista has a different opinion of what light sugar and light milk means. One Batista I'll say "light milk" and get a café au lait, another will hand me something that looks and tastes like black coffee that was just waved in front of a sealed milk carton. It's a cumbersome process to taste, hand the coffee back, taste, etc. I often end up with coffee that's sweeter than I'd like, so I have to take it as is or waste it and wait for them to remake it. If I ask for more milk, it's almost always too much extra.

There's a total lack of control on the customers part for a beverage that is really something everyone makes to their own personal tastes. Sure, have the barista make the entire drink, but can't we at least have milk and sugar available for people who would like to fix their own?
author: Colin M.

description:
Solid cup of coffee.  Tasty avocado toast. Nice bright space. Friendly service. 

Lines can get long during the week day mornings and it is sometimes difficult to find a seat.
author: Heather R.

description:
Wanted to get some sun on the weekend at the Marina Green or the Crissy Fields? Just stop by this Philz Coffee truck to get a pick-me-up before soaking in the sun! I love Philz! Seriously! And sometimes I have a craving, but I don't get it because I dread having to head toward downtown or Van Ness where there are tons of cars. Traffic stresses me out. So it's perfect that Philz has a truck in the Marina away from the craziness! 

I've been here 3 times and there has always been a short line. You will probably get your coffee within about 10-15 minutes at most. 

Like my other reviews of other Philz, it really is the same great coffee as the other locations! But granted, I'm not a huge coffee drinker. I only drink it maybe once a week, but I know what I like and I like this. 

I highly recommend the Ecstatic Iced Coffee or the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. 

Last side note: my friends were visiting from Korea and I took them here. They instantaneously fell in love with the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee and ended up going to Philz at least 3 times during their busy 2 week visit here. They're not coffee fiends either. They just liked it THAT much. Doesn't that say something about how good Philz is?
author: Connie Y.

description: Best iced mocha I've ever had. I rarely finish an iced mocha and I polished off this drink in seconds.
author: Ashley J.

description: After living in San Francisco for 8 months, I decided it was finally time to give into the hype and try Philz. WOW. Got the iced mint mojito and it completely lived up to my expectations. I came here around 10:45 on a Saturday morning, and was pleasantly surprised I only had to wait ~10 mins to order and get my drink. Definitely beats waiting in the line I see at the one in the Financial District.
author: Catherine S.

description: They have the best drinks and the best service consistently. I am so happy they are out here in the Marina! My favorites are the Philtered Soul, Tesora, Tesora Mocha, and Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. But my favorite would definitely be Philtered Soul! It has such a great blend of chocolate and hazelnut.
author: Hana K.

description: On my adventure in SF and exploring coffee shops I came to this other branch of Philz which apparently is newly opened. First of all I like the interior design of it. It's open and welcoming and in a neighborhood that is quiet and isolated from busy urban life. Let me taste the sweet hot chocolate that I got which Danish pastry. Just a sec ..... Yummy ! Liked it guys. Ok so wi fi is good, there is enough outlets and seats available on a Sunday morning, tho I guess this hangs when people get to know this place. Interior is one of those cool designs that a warehouse changes into a something like a bar or club or a coffee shop, I personally like such vibe so in loving it.
author: Majid D.

description: This is a great coffee shop and maybe my favorite Philz location. The space is big with plenty of seating inside and outdoors. Service is great, and the "Philz bagel" I got was great. Wifi is reasonably fast considering how many people are using it at any given time.
author: Joseph N.

description: I've been here a couple of time and I can definitely say this is my favorite Philz Coffee location. The layout is spacious and there is a ton of seating and work space. It's a pretty cool place because the cashier told me that this is actually their HQ location. I was asking about the offices located upstairs and who worked there. The staff is super friendly as well. This is my new study/work spot in SF and I'm so happy its only about a 12 min drive from home! Definitely the best PHIL COFFEE LOCATION IN SAN FRANCISCO!
author: Melanie T.

description: Just like every Philz I've ever been to, this one has great coffee, a good selection of food/snacks, and pleasant folks working here.  The ambiance is great as well. Just an awesome location to drop in for a coffee break and get some work done.
author: Vas N.

description: This is my Cheers spot. For those who remember this show you will understand. For those who don't too bad for you.  Everyone knows my name. They are so happy and cheerful to see me.   They give me so much love!   What better way to start my morning or get a boost in the afternoon.  I'm so thankful they are 6 minutes away from my work.  My figure probably isn't too happy but hey you only live once and Jacobs sweet and creamy or the mint mojito tastes so damn good!  I have a favorite Batista that I absolutely adore and love.   He always brightens my day and I leave with a smile.  Thank you Phil and Jacob for creating this special place that feels like family.
author: Cortne B.

description: And I'm not a coffee drinker but the people who work here are awesome individuals who seem to enjoy what they do. Kudos to them and what they share through each cup!
author: David M. S.

description:
The guy ahead of us said, "Whats the big Whoop?" We waited in line...ordered and waited again. He had the Mocha, I had the Ginger Snap... we both looked at one and said, is that all there is?
We fell big time for the Blue Bottle Coffee promo...tres cher. Not impressed.
There are coffee joints on every corner of the City...
Note: At least the Dogpatch site is quieter the other two - with the ones out the door I almost tried.
author: Red J.

description: I didn't purchase any food here, but when it's my turn, the woman said I should wait behind the line till she finished the order from someone who rushed ahead of me, which means I need to start my line again.
author: Zhouyu L.

description: I am thrilled to have a Philz in my neighborhood.  I tend to go on Friday mornings, and the crew is flirty and charismatic. I walk outta there all flustered. Thanks, ladies!
author: Michelle P.

description:
- mint mojito = yum. tastes clean and refreshing like a tea.
- ginger snap = good.  more like cinnamon than ginger but still decent. 
- self-serve ice cucumber water + milk bone dog treats. 
- spacious,  open,  natural light = good study/work spot.
author: Joji J.

description: Customer service is great, the space is great & the drinks I've gotten so far are great as well. I'd say the only tough thing is parking so if you're trying to stop by and leave, it might take a while. But if you're wanting to hangout and enjoy a great cup of mint mojito, Philz is the spot!
author: Meryllia L.

description: First timers. They were supper friendly. The coffee was delicious and fresh. Aldo had a wonderful bagel. Yum. Yum.
author: Cassandra F.

description: my new favorite location!!! urban feel in a warehouseish ambiance. great location for such an upcoming area in SF!!!!!
author: Sarina A.

description: The coffee is always well done at Philz and this location is just the icing on top of a caffeinated cake. Plenty of space to sit and enjoy in an up and coming area.
author: Marisa K.

description: First time visiting a Philz Coffee. The location is great with parking available. The inside is large with tall ceilings and cool vibe. I ordered a hot tea and it wasn't a tea bag and water. They put some effort into it and it was great! I will definitely visit again and try some of their food. I wish they had a place to stand and work but that's my beef with all coffee shops. Not everyone likes to sit for hours. Look forward to visiting again.
author: M G.

description: I have been drinking Philz one cup at a time since 2011 and my brother had me meet him at this location 2 weeks ago and the place is amazing just like the New Manhattan that Damian who was a very excellent representative/barista brewed up for me. I will be sure to visit here again most def!
author: Jimmy P.

description: What a great spot! Decor was great and the internet worked so well. I'll definitely be coming back. Also so many tasty food options
author: Lauren G.

description:
1/29/16 UPDATE: i was contacted by a very professional customer service rep. who acknowledged the unfortunate incident & offered a very gracious ammends. good to know some people still 'care' in this day & age instead of taking the low road & lashing out, being apathetic or assuming you are telling tales.. thank you Luke & Phil for givin' a darn. ;)


i just walked in here (in uniform) 26 minutes ago to grab a coffee & a few lbs for my captain & station. it was my first time in this location as we all usually go to good ole Philz on 24th. it was 5:59am. 

doors were wide open, lights full on.. music playing & 2 staff behind the counter. one guy looked a little like a shorter Jack Black & the other guy was a thin African American guy w/glasses. both ignored me as they went about their stuff..

i politley exscused myself to get their attention & asked if they had the coffee lbs. ground already or not. both stare at me like i'm insane.

then Jack black says: "uhm.. actually, we aren't open yet. we're not open for 3 more minutes..." he says glancing at a wall clock. i look at my iphone clock which reads: 5:59am. really guys?! i asked what time they open in case i was in the Twilight Zone. he confirms: 6am. ugh.. petty.. lame.. Phil would be disappointed.. & i will run it by him next time i see him.. rude, to say the least.

i left (as they mumbled behind me) & drove over to the 24th street Philz where they were professionally serving customers without the antics.

whyyyyyyyy guys?!?!! not necessary & just plain unprofessional.
author: Anon M.

description: Been to every philz ever opened (Facebook HQ is the exception). This one by far has the coolest space  -- good to see some of the veteran employees from the other locations like 24th st. are here to get this place rolling.
author: Dan E.

description: This place is very clean and the staffs are super friendly. Love the large space as well. That place almost got five stars from me, The reason why it's four stars is because the food takes forever. There have been several times where I've waited 15 to 20 minutes just for a bagel
author: Danielle D.

description: I love this spot, it's very low key and the interior is pleasant. The staff are friendly and attentive. Coffee in the morning!
author: Rick M.

description: Tony made a believer out of a friend of mine from the East Coast.  It was the best Mint Mojito Iced coffee ever.
author: Nishant S.

description: I wandered over there today with my co-workers. It's really inviting. The workers are very friendly and the space is very large. It's as clean as it can be. I don't go out for coffee very often but I will definitely put this on my radar for those times when I feel the need to have a special cup of caffeine!!!
author: Cindy J.

description: We stopped by this coffee truck before leaving town, and we were just blown away with our drinks! Great service very helpful and our drinks both hot and iced were amazing! We will be seeking them out again every time we are here in San Francisco! Thank you!
author: Ashley T.

description: Beautiful new Philz! Very spacious and tucked away on a quiet street in a cool neighborhood. Since it's the headquarters you feel the buzz of the Philz employees around the 'office'. Everyone is really nice and of course the food and drinks are on point! Yummy bagels - ask for light cream cheese if you don't like a heavy hand. Can't wait to see the University open - I've been told to ask if they have a drink they need tested. Overall my fave location so far!
author: Amy M.

description: This is the nicest, most spacious Philz I've ever been to. My favorite drink is the Mint Mojito iced coffee with almond milk. I'm so glad they participate in Orderahead.
author: Oli J.

description: A Fantastic cup of coffee! The staff is super friendly and make your coffee exactly how you like it. Wish you guys were in Dallas!
author: Kate C.

description: I'm a brooklyn transplant living in the Marina on the company's dime. If I had a choice I'd live above a Philz Coffee, so the Marina coffee truck is my weekend go-to. I was hooked after my first mocha but today I tried a Jacob's WonderBar & it was amazing. So buttery, like the time I tried using butter instead of milk in my espresso because of a buzzfeed article I read -but without the floating curds.  Shout-out to the truck crew, you guys rock.
author: Jordan P.

description: Oh, man. I am so grateful they have a truck. I was itching for some Philz yesterday after walking around Fort Mason. This truck came to the rescue. Thank you, sweet prince.
author: Sonlay V.

description: If your in the mission this is the best local spot for a cup of coffee and a bagel it's one of the pest places that have a good seating system and plenty of joyful people
author: William V.

description: I usually like philz, but this location is very inconsistent. Lately, I order a coffee and get very diluted coffee water. It's like drinking hot water with a sprinkle of coffee flavor. This is really not worth the $5 it cost.
author: Dan Q.

description: This place always has great service. The employees I've met seem genuinely happy to be there and are able to help you navigate their extensive coffee list. The large list of coffees is sometimes daunting, but I enjoy switching it up and exploring new flavors. And if you branch out and try something new and don't like it, the baristas will make you something more to your liking. I've never asked for a "redo", but it's nice to know there is that safety net if you're feeling adventurous. My favorite is the Philharmonic. This location definitely fills a need in this area. There are few coffeehouses within walking distance, and if you're pressed for time, walking a few blocks can take 20+ minutes. I appreciated the food offerings, and eat their breakfast burritos or Phil's bagel for lunch in a pinch. I would be thrilled with even more selections, but realize their main business is gourmet coffee drinks. Nice atmosphere, but often crowded with people on their laptops for long periods of time, so be aware of that if you have several people in your party. A perk: self-service cucumber-mint water at the entrance!
author: Jules M.

description: If you're bored with your regular cup of joe this is coffee with a twist. A must try if you are in the city. I had the arabian coffee with mint leaves on top.
author: Nicole W.

description: If you were blindfolded and your friend made you drink 2 different cups of Philz coffee, one from this truck and one from a store, you would not be able to tell the difference!!! My ecstatic iced coffee from here was so delicious and it's in a perfect location because there is an actual parking lot you can park your car in! Then you can walk on over to Crissy Field and enjoy your coffee :)
author: Alice H.

description:
I don't write reviews very often but when I do, it's usually because I truly enjoyed my experience at a certain place, or I absolutely did not. In this case, I did not enjoy my experience here.

This was my first time at this Philz Coffee and the coffee I received was very good. Also, the employee who made my coffee (the nice lady with a triangle pattern tattoo) was very friendly as well.  However, I'm only giving 2 stars because the cashier working this morning at 9:30 am, and the short barista with long hair and a beard were quite rude to me.  

My friends and I came in this morning and it being our first time, approached the cash register to order our drinks.  We were corrected and directed by the cashier to stand at the orange circle so that we could be picked up by a barista to take our order. No problem. After a small mixup with another lady waiting in the orange circle, I thought that the shorter man with the beard was ready to take my order, so I approached him. Unfortunately, he very condescendingly told me, "Step back sir. You have to wait in the orange circle. Step back. Step back. Okay? Okay? Okay," while giving me a hand gesture to shoo me back to the orange circle.  Luckily the nicer lady I mentioned earlier took my order afterwards and was patient enough to explain that Philz doesn't do americano's (which I normally drink). After recommending a drink to me, I proceeded to the register and told the cashier that I ordered an americano but that the barista recommended me another drink. He then rudely tells me, "I don't think you understand. We do things differently here. You have stand in the orange circle and wait for a barista to call you and take your order." After explaining to him that I already waited in the orange circle AND already ordered but just forgot the name of my drink, I told him that he could ask the barista what it was that she made for me. The cashier then rolled his eyes and walked away to speak to the barista about the order.

I've been around the world and have had coffee in many different places. Coffee should not be pretentious and those that are serving it shouldn't be rudely making hand gestures or rolling their eyes.  I really wanted to enjoy this place but unfortunately, I don't think I'll ever return to this particular location.
author: Jowett L.

description: Back in the fall, my girlfriend and I would come here when we were bored before work, and by "come here when we were bored before work" I mean it was at 7:30 in the morning and we were trying to blink the nighttime ceiling from our eyes. You know. Anyway, we tried ordering different things for awhile. There was this girl who wore a colorful, flowing fur cap. She seemed to know a lot about the business. The ones with vibrant colors always do. There's this painting of two giraffes next to where we usually sit, and my girlfriend always points them out and calls one the baby and the other the mom, though it could've been an alternate perspective of necks. Who knows. One time there was a group of cops enjoying cups around a pair of square tables they had pushed together. I wondered if they had authority in doing this, like usual, or if the employees found power in their own hands. I could see the girl with the hat rushing to do this sort of thing. But she wasn't there. Actually, I noticed the entire place had been rearranged: the large leather seat my girlfriend and I shared last time had been moved to another corner and replaced with a table from another angle. Then I wondered how that changed the room, or the customers' revival of the same experience but through a different air--who walked in first and noticed the shift? I used to be obsessed with rearranging my bedroom for this exact reason; I'd walk in after school the next day, flip the light switch, and feel that brief second when your mind shoots in remarkably quick directions to find a reason for the change, someone to blame. But maybe it's just me always bored with stagnant atmospheres: same light, same gravity & weight, same smell of french roast drifting in from the kitchen to wake me up early.
author: Logan E.

description: Great neighborhood hangout with endless selection of beverages ;) If you're unable to choose from sweet to mocha or milky to creamy just ask a barista and they'll be more than happy to suggest the right cup for you! Don't forget a treat or two.. Especially the chocolate chip cookie!!
author: Ula K.

description: I SO want this to be 5-star but as this is a training center the coffee is inconsistent every time. Which would be more okay if there were more of a discount or notification about people learning. In general I love Philz and love that I have a walkable one but my desire to pay full price for a disappointing cup of coffee isn't always there.
author: Elisabeth H.

description: Amazing customer service. Each Philz location offers its own unique vibe. This Philz has a clean crisp laid back feel to it, a more modern location.  a nice hidden gem in the dog patch area. I love their iced green tea! But this review is mostly to show my appreciation to the amazing staff. All very welcoming and friendly.
author: Leli C.

description: Love this location and all the staff here.  Special shout-out's to Damien + Connor who are always taking care of me and my colleagues when we need some coffee in our lives :)
author: Robin E.

description: Clean, efficient, great service. If you have an allergy or dietary concern, most everything is labeled, or in a nearby binder. Tamara and Will were above and beyond helpful, the food fresh and the beverages hot. Worth a stop and sip as well as a grab and go.
author: Alissa H.

description: LOVE the ginger snap iced coffee! Love the iced chai even more. Both are perfectly creamy and spiced. Also, great service by the staff at this truck. They ask what level of sweetness you like when you order, then they make sure you're happy with it when you get it. Definitely five stars!
author: Riz W.

description: Great atmosphere. It's like I just walked in to the Pinterest HQ, but there's coffee. The people were super friendly. And they were playing 50 Cent. #GreatWorkspace
author: Owen J.

description: I am a coffee snob, to say the least.  This is by far, the BEST coffee I've ever had in my life.  One cup of "perfection" at a time
author: Jennifer B.

description: Mint Mojito iced coffee is amazing. Highly recommended
author: Scoot S.

description: Love this coffee truck! It's my go-to on the weekends. Order the mint mojito iced coffee. You won't be disappointed!
author: D R.
